fields.headline: Dew
fields.bodyText: 1. Train delays caused by dew on the line would sound laughable in almost any country in the world, but to weary travellers on the great British transport network, outrage is a more likely response than laughter. 2. Who, after all, has not felt the red tide of anger rise within when rail staff try to fob you off with limp excuses. 3. Leaves, we have been led to believe, can play havoc with any timetable. If the snow that dusts our lines is of the wrong kind, we will never reach our destination. 4. What, quite frankly, do they expect? 5. This is, after all, the season of mists and mellow fruitfulness. Surely, dew, is to be expected. 6. You don't have to be a weather forecaster to predict that by morning there will be moisture on the rails. 7. Dew, any gardener knows, is nothing more than water that has condensed on a cool surface. 8. Perhaps only a train company would have it in its power to extract anger from such an innocuous substance. It has for centuries raised poetic musings rather than people's ire. 9. Only poetry can capture the simplistic beauty of a dew drop. 10. It could well be the tonic to soothe the irritation of our delays and lead us to a happy end.
